alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:15AM EST until January 11 at 5:22PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to occur. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia are under a foot of water. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 4 feet deep with closure of the paths. This especially occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be under a two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 10.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM EST.
